Package.Name: clr-boot-manager
Package.Description:
clr-boot-manager exists to enable the correct maintenance of vendor kernels and appropriate garbage collection tactics over the course of upgrades. The implementation provides the means to enable correct cohabitation on a shared boot directory, such as the EFI System Partition for UEFI-booting operating systems.
Special care is taken to ensure the ESP is handled gracefully, and in the instance that it is not already mounted, then clr-boot-manager will automatically discover and mount it, and automatically unmount the ESP again when it is complete.
Most importantly, clr-boot-manager provides a simple mechanism to provide kernel updates, with the ability for users to rollback to an older kernel should the new update be problematic. This is achieved through the use of strict namespace policies, permanent source paths, and clr-boot-manager's own internal logic, without the need for "meta packages" or undue complexity on the distribution side.

Update.Comment: Safety rebuild
Update.Name: Joshua Strobl

Update.Comment: Re-upgrade to latest release
Update.Name: Joshua Strobl

Update.Comment:
Downgrade to 3.2.7 for systemd v244
systemd v245 requires the "default" field to end in ".conf" and clr-boot-manager was updated to make this change in 3.2.8. However, since we downgraded to v244, this fix actually breaks loader.conf by having ".conf" as the postfix.
Update.Name: Bryan T. Meyers

Update.Comment:
Update clr-boot-manager to 3.2.9
Summary: Update clr-boot-manager to 3.2.9 Changelog: - Added commandline completion for bash and zsh - Fixed bug with cmdline-removal.d configs not applying - Added syslinux support - Support of system without a dedicated partition to /boot - Command set-timeout now also performs the update itself triggering the boot configuration update - Documentation: listing the file system support table to the README file, the --help output now shows the possible flags (namely --path and --image) - Added configuration to avoid touching efi variables, it's useful for dual-boot scenarios when a user wants to manually manage the efi entries - Added user initrd configuration. User now can add their own initrd freestanding to /etc/kernel/initrd.d and also mask system's initrd by creating a symlink pointing to /dev/null - Fixed set-kernel for legacy bios mode - the configuration files wasn't being created, resulting on unbootable system - Fix list-kernels for legacy bios mode - default kernel wasn't being marked as default - Cleaned up the syslinux/extlinux removing a ton of code duplication - Fixed an issue with systemd 245 bootloader configuration compatibility - Added support for software RAID root device - Other minor fixes and improvements
Test Plan: - Install on UEFI machine without LUKS - run clr-boot-manager update - manually mount /boot efi partition - run clr-boot-manager update - run clr-boot-manager list-kernels - Install on VBox EFI installation with LUKS - run clr-boot-manager update - manually mount /boot efi partition - run clr-boot-manager update - run clr-boot-manager list-kernels - Install on Vbox non-EFI installation with LUKS (legacy mode with GRUB bootloader) - run clr-boot-manager update - run clr-boot-manager list-kernels
Reviewers: #triage_team, DataDrake
Reviewed By: #triage_team, DataDrake
Subscribers: DataDrake, JoshStrobl, joebonrichie, Jacalz, Girtablulu
Differential Revision: https://dev.getsol.us/D6850
Update.Name: chax

Update.Comment:
Update clr-boot-manager to 3.1.0
Summary: Update clr-boot-manager to 3.1.0 **Changelog**: - 3.1.0 - Enable commandline removal configuration files - Enable listing of available kernels (displaying the current default kernel) - Enable setting the default kernel independently of running an update
- 3.0.0 - Grub support has been removed as the last user of it went away - Cleanup of vmlinux files (an optional file with per kernel associations) - Increase the size of the kernel type field
- 2.1.1 - Add support for non-lvm root encryption - Fix issues with handling free standing initrds - Update libnica version to fix issue removing module directories
- 2.1.0 - add support for --with-initrd-dir option - Improves documentation for kernel commandline configuration files
- 2.0.0 - Enable the ability to use two stage kernel loading via shim and systemd-boot. - Enable the creation of EFI variables to determine the default bootloader - Convert build system to meson - Updated the code sytle documentation to be more thorough - Removal of clang-format as a CI check due to inconsistency - Various spelling fixes
Test Plan: - Successfull kernel update inside a LUKS VM (Grub install) - Successfull kernel update with a notebook set up wit LUKS (Grub install) - Successfull kernel update with a non-luks system (Systemd-boot install) - Could not test it with a LUKS systemd-boot install
Test inside a VM with bios by installing a new iso, update the clr-boot-->reboot-->full update - Budgie normal/llvm/luks no issues - Mate normal/llvm/luks no issues - Gnome and Plasma could not be tested because they decided to be special and act up inside the vm
Reviewers: #triage_team, JoshStrobl
Reviewed By: #triage_team, JoshStrobl
Subscribers: xulongwu4, JoshStrobl, DataDrake, Jacalz
Differential Revision: https://dev.getsol.us/D4633
Update.Name: F. von Gellhorn

Update.Comment:
Revert clr-boot-manager to 1.5.5
To ensure that users with encryption have the previous version installed until issues are resolved.
Update.Name: Peter O'Connor

Update.Comment: Updated clr-boot-manager to 3.0.0
Update.Name: Bryan T. Meyers

Update.Comment:
Backport nica patch to ensure module tree is properly cleaned out
Signed-off-by: Ikey Doherty <ikey@solus-project.com>
Update.Name: Ikey Doherty

Update.Comment:
Begin deprecation of goofiboot (T4235)
Switch clr-boot-manager to now use systemd-boot by default instead of goofiboot. Existing installs will be unaffected by the transition in a negative capacity, save for the wasted 84k on the ESP (nothing we can truly do about this.)
EFI Vars for "Linux Boot Manager" will continue booting the old stub and the default entry (which is what the majority are using) will boot the new stub. Users wishing to manually transition can use bootctl to reinstall the stub.
When Solus transitions to clr-boot-manager 2.0 (not scheduled to happen immediately until we've done some work upstream to support efivar management in a more generic fashion) we'll automatically handle the var switch.
Signed-off-by: Ikey Doherty <ikey@solus-project.com>
Update.Name: Ikey Doherty

Update.Comment:
Update `clr-boot-manager` to 1.5.5
- Fix various build warnings - Support vendor cmdline files - Address upstream util-linux (libblkid) regression for LVM installations
This release now also supports vendor fragments for cmdlines. For full details, please see the [changelog](https://github.com/clearlinux/clr-boot-manager/releases/tag/v1.5.5).
Additionally, this update fixes T4763 and will be deployed with the next sync window to fix kernel promotions.
Signed-off-by: Ikey Doherty <ikey@solus-project.com>
Update.Name: Ikey Doherty

Package.Name: emacs-devel
Package.Description: GNU Emacs is an extensible, customizable text editor—and more. At its core is an interpreter for Emacs Lisp, a dialect of the Lisp programming language with extensions to support text editing. It has many features to increase productivity when programming.

Update.Comment: Rebuild against toolchain
Update.Name: Joshua Strobl

Update.Comment:
Emacs: Update to 27.2
This is a bug-fix release with no new features. Changelog [here](https://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/news/NEWS.27.2)
Update.Name: Rune Morling

Update.Comment:
emacs: 26.3 -> 27.1
Release Highlights:
- Built-in support for arbitrary-size integers - Text shaping with HarfBuzz - Native support for JSON parsing - Better support for Cairo drawing - Portable dumping used instead of unexec - Support for XDG conventions for init files - Additional early-init initialization file - Lexical-binding is used by default - Built-in support for tab bar and tab-line - Support for resizing and rotating of images without ImageMagick
Full [NEWS.27.1](https://www.gnu.org/savannah-checkouts/gnu/emacs/news/NEWS.27.1) Release Notes.
Test Plan:
- Start emacs and make sure that spacemacs loads and can update packages via ELPA - Check that PNG/JPEG/GIFF/SVG images load and show correctly - Check that the magit package works by browsing a git project and displaying diffs interactivley - Check that LSP add-ons are fetched and load automatically (tested with mpylsp)
Update.Name: Rune Morling

Update.Comment: Safety rebuild
Update.Name: Joshua Strobl

Update.Comment: Properly bump package.
Update.Name: Joshua Strobl

Update.Comment:
Rebuild for gnutls-3.6.10
Resolves T8385
Update.Name: Rune Morling

Update.Comment:
Update to 26.3
**Changelog:**
- New option `help-enable-completion-auto-load` - This allows disabling the new feature introduced in Emacs 26.1 which loads files during completion of 'C-h f' and 'C-h v' according to 'definition-prefixes' - Emacs now supports the new Japanese Era name - The newly assigned codepoint U+32FF was added to the Unicode Character Database compiled into Emacs.
Update.Name: Joshua Strobl

Update.Comment:
Update emacs to 26.2, fixes T7849
Summary: **Summarized Changelog:** - Emacs is now compliant with the latest version 11.0 of the Unicode Standard. - In Dired, the 'Z' command on a directory name compresses all of its files. - Emacs modules can now be built outside of the Emacs tree source. - Various improvements to ibuffer, imenu, gnus, shell and vc.
Fixes T7849
Test Plan: - Opened various different text files - Opened NEWS file for some reason
Reviewers: #triage_team, ermo
Reviewed By: #triage_team, ermo
Subscribers: ermo
Maniphest Tasks: T7849
Differential Revision: https://dev.getsol.us/D5985
Update.Name: Jacob Alzén

Update.Comment:
Fix ispell checking when using the latest version of hunspell (1.7.0)
Summary: Added a patch which fixes ispell checking with the latest version of hunspell (1.7.0). The initial bug report can be found [here](https://debbugs.gnu.org/cgi/bugreport.cgi?bug=33493).
Test Plan: Ran 'emacs -Q' and tested using 'M-$' to check the spelling of several words. Ran emacs using my config with the spell checking working as it did before the update to the 'libhunspell' package.
Reviewers: #triage_team, DataDrake
Reviewed By: #triage_team, DataDrake
Subscribers: DataDrake
Differential Revision: https://dev.getsol.us/D4622
Update.Name: James Lee

Update.Comment:
Safety rebuild against dbus
Signed-off-by: Joey Riches <josephriches@gmail.com>
Update.Name: Joey Riches
